      • encode

        public byte[] encode(ACLMessage aMsg,
            java.lang.Object... parameters)
        Encodes a given ACL Message into an array of bytes (which is commonly called the payload).
        Parameters:
        aMsg - is the ACL Message to encode
        parameters -
        Returns:
        the ACLMessage encoded in an array of bytes

      • decode

        public ACLMessage decode(ACLTransportMessage tMsg,
                java.lang.Object... parameters)
        Gets the ACL Message from an ACL Transport Message.
        • The ACL Transport Message corresponds to the payload

        • The payload has been previously encoded by encode(ACLMessage, Object...) as defined by FIPA : [ [Envelope Length] | [Envelope] | [Content] ]

        Workflow :

        1. Get the envelope length
        2. Get back the envelope in an array bytes according to the previously recovered envelope length
        3. Get back the corresponding ACLMessageEnvelope
        4. Get the content length according to the global length and the envelope length
        5. Get back the content in an array of bytes according to the previously recovered content length
        6. Get back the corresponding ACLMessageContent
        7. Create a new ACL Message from the recovered envelope and content
        Parameters:
        tMsg - the ACLTransportMessage containing the encoded ACLMessage (payload)
        parameters -
        Returns:
        the new ACLMessage decoded and rebuilt
